description: There should be a describe-by link, that gives an URL with information about the extension in the extension response.  Otherwise it's hard to tell what an extension really is.
title: Missing describe-by link in extension call

comments.content: There should be a describe-by link, that gives an URL with information about the extension in the extension response.  Otherwise it's hard to tell what an extension really is.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jorgew

comments.content:
A describedby link is supposed to point you to a resource that describes the current context. Adding a describedby link to an extension object should point me at a resource that describes the structure of an arbitrary extension entity. It shouldn't be specific to any extension itself.

Looking at http://www.iana.org/assignments/link-relations/link-relations.xml, I think 'related' actually makes more sense. According to http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4287, a 'related' resource "signifies that the IRI in the value of the href attribute identifies a resource related to the resource described by the containing element." Would you agree?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~bcwaldon

comments.content:
No, I disagree.

The context of the describeby link is the extension entity itself.  So in other words: *this* extension is described by *this* resource.  I think that that's appropriate use of describeby.

I'm sure that related can also fit, but I think that in this case describeby is more specific to what we want.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jorgew

comments.content: If we had the extension 'waldon', when you make a request for the 'waldon' entity added by the extension at /servers/<SERVER_ID>/waldon, I would expect to see a 'describedby' link telling me how to parse waldon. If I ask for /extensions/waldon, I need to know how to parse what is given back to me. In that context, its a descriptive extension entity, not a waldon.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~bcwaldon
